project.teaser: CHRONICLE will deliver a holistic, life-cycle performance assessment framework and tool-suite for different building variants, supporting sustainable design, construction and/or efficient renovation and investment decision making. It will be methodologically integrate ongoing...
project.objective: CHRONICLE will deliver a holistic, life-cycle performance assessment framework and tool-suite for different building variants, supporting sustainable design, construction and/or efficient renovation and investment decision making. It will be methodologically integrate ongoing initiatives, like EPCs, Level(s), SRI, under the umbrella of the Digital Building Logbook concept. Performance will be assessed by means of well-defined KPIs, based on both static (by design) as well as dynamic information (sensor measurements) appropriately tailored to different types of use and building life-cycle phases (new or existing buildings under refurbishment). Continuous monitoring and analysis of the actual building performance over its lifetime, will be based on a powerful digital twin framework. The proposed data availability and accessibility within CHRONICLE will extend the limits of the EU energy related policies while the aggregated EPC advanced information will facilitate efficient energy planning. To this end, CHRONICLE will allow all stakeholders to realize in quantified terms the short- and long-term impact of the project activities, from policy to practice, and across the whole building life cycle. It will therefore promote evidence-based impact assessment practices to support policy coherence, design of smart penalties and reward schemes towards motivating energy consciousness, while also paying attention to the voice of market stakeholders (AECs, ESCOs, FMs) but also building owners and tenants/occupants, who are directly impacted by future regulatory decisions. CHRONICLE’s building performance assessment framework and tool-set will be demonstrated and validated in five pilot sites spanning the geographic diversity of Europe, namely in Spain, Ireland, Denmark, Greece and Switzerland.
project.title: Building Performance Digitalisation and Dynamic Logbooks for Future Value-Driven Services
project.keywords: Digital Building Logbook, Whole Life Carbon, Climate-Neutral Buildings, Building Performance Assessment, Smart Readiness Indicator, Energy Performance Certification

article.title: Impact assessment practices to better design, construct and/ renovate buildings

result.title: Dissemination & communication plan and activity report
result.description: This deliverable will include the CHRONICLE Dissemination and Communication Plan (DCP), the co-design framework building on the Living Labs concept to be followed by the project activities, as well as concrete plans for the establishment and exploitation of synergies with other relevant European and national projects. Activities stemming from the execution of these plans will be reported in subsequent versions of the deliverable. Related tasks are T6.1 – T6.3.

result.title: Defining Valuable Data and Stakeholder Engagement in Digital Building Logbooks: A Framework for Effective Data Storage

details.authors: Andrea Ibba, Sun Ah Hwang, Diego Reforgiato Recupero, Rubén Alonso, Rosamaria Olivadese
details.journalTitle: Computing in Construction, Proceedings of the 2024 European Conference on Computing in Construction
details.publisher: European Council for Computing in Construction

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 2 - CHRONICLE (Building Performance Digitalisation and Dynamic Logbooks for Future Value-Driven Services)
result.teaser: Buildings account for 40% of Europe’s energy consumption, yet the existing stock is largely inefficient and aging, with 80% still in use by 2050. Decarbonization requires improvements in design and renovation, but assessing emissions is complex due to building variability...

webItem.alternativeText: Tree in building, image representing green buildings.

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: The deliverable will describe the Data Management Plan (DMP), the actions for data collection and handling, storage, protection (citizen data privacy/security, etc), retention and destruction. The compliance of the aforementioned actions with national and EU legislation will also be included. The deliverable will encapsulate open access to research data. Related task is T1.3

result.title: CHRONICLE tool suite for WLC assessment and climate neutral building renovation planning: 1st revision
result.description: This deliverable will demonstrate: (i) the application for building renovation planning (Renovation Planner ) and; (ii) the application for Whole Life Carbon (WLC) assessment balancing cost, value and risk. It will report the integrated and (semi)-automated framework for a circular building sector addressing social, sustainability, circularity aspects in all phases of building renovation. Related tasks are T4.3 – T4.4.This deliverable will only include high-level description of the tools and the design/engineering phase of the tools.

result.title: CHRONICLE Data Model and Common Data Environment
result.description: The purpose of this deliverable will be twofold i.e., (i) to document the building Digital Twin (DT) data model capable to capture all data requirements for the digital representation of buildings, their operations and the information required for building performance assessment and certification and; (ii) to demonstrate the CHRONICLE Common Data Environment (CDE) that collects, manages, collaborates, and shares information with the relevant systems. Related task is T3.1.

result.title: Towards the definition of a European Digital Building Logbook: A survey

details.authors: ubén Alonso; Rosamaria Olivadese; Andrea Ibba; Diego Reforgiato Recupero

result.title: CHRONICLE dynamic Level(s) approach for building and LC performance assessment
result.description: In this deliverable a unified approach based on multi-criteria analysis will be introduced. The aforementioned approach will combine indicators / methodologies related to: (i) sustainability and reliable Whole Life Carbon (WLC) assessment; (ii) human comfort, wellbeing and social factors and; (iii) lifecycle cost analysis for investment optimization and de-risking. Moreover, a Smart Readiness Indicator (SRI) framework will be established. Related tasks are T2.2 – T2.6.

result.title: CHRONICLE Business requirements, Use cases & System architecture
result.description: The deliverable will report the end-user requirements based on concrete business scenarios and Use Cases (UCs). The architecture, interfaces, functional and non-functional specifications of CHRONICLE components will also be defined. Related task is T2.1.

result.title: CHRONICLE BIM-based digital twin framework
result.description: This deliverable will demonstrate the building data-driven and physics-based building DTs that will act either individually or in combination in order to support different scenarios. Related tasks are T3.2 – T3.4.

category.title: sensors
category.displayCode: /engineering and technology/electrical engineering, electronic engineering, information engineering/electronic engineering/sensors

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
